It was very clean and welcoming. The living room looks just like it does in the picture. It is very quiet. Chris did a great job of letting us know how  to get into her apartment and what we would find in the apartment (coffee and coffeemaker, for example).  She also gave us some great ideas for places to visit in the neighborhood. My friend who happened to be going to a restaurant she recommended and he said the review was spot on.  \r\n\r\nThe building dates back to 1899 so it can be startling when you enter. It has concrete floors in the entry halls and an old elevator with a door that slides open and a gate. It's somewhat dark in the evening. Once you get past that, you will be rewarded with Chris' place that has exposed brick and a comfortable feel appropriate to the neighborhood. She also has a well-stocked library and nice artwork for a homey feel.  \r\n\r\nWe stayed at the apartment during the longest days of the year.  That means it gets light very early in the morning in Boston (5 am). It was helpful for those days when I had to be up very early.  Not so great when I wanted to sleep in a little.  This will improve as the days get shorter and I suspect with some darker curtains or shades. \r\n\r\nIf you like central air (which we didn't need since we had perfect weather), then this is not the place for you (remember the building is over 100 years old). The  bedroom has a window air conditioner that really cools off the bedroom, which was all we needed. \r\n\r\nFor storage space, there are two closets in the bedroom. I didn't discover the largely empty closet behind the bedroom door until the third day. There was also some shelf space in the top shelves of the dresser and in the hanging shelves in the closet. I had a lot of clothes because I was attending a conference with different outfits during the day so it was a little short on space for me (plus I tend to pack on the heavy side) but not too bad.\r\n\r\nThe neighborhood is one of the best in Boston and is a good reason on its own to stay here.  I had to walk through the Public Garden and the beautiful Back Bay streets each day to get to my conference. (15 minutes to Copley Square.)  The streets are beautiful and historic. You are only blocks from the Statehouse and incredible architecture from the 1800's. In the other direction you are a short walk to the Esplanade on the Charles River.  The Boston Commons is just across Charles Street from the Public Garden. And Charles Street offers excellent dining and shopping options (Tatte Bakery is great for morning coffee and pastries.) Jay\'s recommendations are spot on! The only thing I want to point out, and Jay did NOT misrepresent his flat, but something I take for granted being from Texas, is central A/C.  Jay provided an oscillating fan; however, we went in August and it was very warm in the house even with the windows open and the fan on. The apartment was clean and tidy, with fresh sheets and towels and Jay was extremely responsive to all messages and requests. Overall, a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. Highly recommend for a couple or pair of friends. \r\n\r\nMy only cautions would be:\r\na) Accessibility - the apartment is located up a fairly steep hill, and then on the top floor of the building so 5 flights of stairs. It does list this in the profile but if you were planning to come and go frequently and/or have accessibility concerns, this may not be ideal.\r\nb) Building age - something the photos perhaps don\'t capture is the age of the building. Whilst the original exposed bricks and wooden floorboards are gorgeous, the building is fairly old (as are many in this part of town). If you\'re after the brand-new/"hotel" experience, this may not be for you either.', u'recipient_id': 20907980, u'can_be_edited': False, u'author_id': 7274656, u'id': 31871590}, {u'listing_id': 4032756, u'author': {u'identity_mt_verified': False, u'first_name': u'Guill', u'identity_v2_verified': False, u'picture_large_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/15792346/profile_pic/1429665254/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_large', u'identity_verified': True, u'created_at': u'2014-05-21T05:01:35Z', u'picture_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/15792346/profile_pic/1429665254/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium', u'has_profile_pic': True, u'acceptance_rate': u'N/A', u'is_superhost': False, u'is_trip_host': False, u'thumbnail_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/15792346/profile_pic/1429665254/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small', u'reviewee_count': 3, u'recommendation_count': 0, u'thumbnail_medium_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/15792346/profile_pic/1429665254/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_medium', u'response_rate': u'N/A', u'id': 15792346, u'response_time': u'N/A'}, u'created_at': u'2015-04-27T16:33:39Z', u'comments': u"Perfect location, very nice flat! One night we were photographing late and didn't walk back to the place until after midnight.  There were still people walking in the area.  John Kerry's (our secretary of state) house is in Beacon Hill.  The area boasts yummy restaurants close by.  There's also a market just around the corner from Bernardo's townhouse.  And just another half mile away (possibly closer), there's also WholeFoods and a CVS pharmacy.  The Blue line (train station) was close.\r\n\r\nOn our end we mostly walked because 1) we love walking and 2) most of the historical places were relatively within walking distance.   And if we didn't feel like walking we just got on our iPhones and contacted Uber for a ride.  You don't need a car if you are staying at Bernardo's place.  In fact, if you do have a car, you can't park in the area because parking is for residents only.  With that said, again you don't need a car.  That didn't bother us because again we just contacted Uber for a ride (definitely better than contacting a taxi and half the price of a taxi).\r\n\r\nAll in all, I would definitely stay at Bernardo's place again.  Bernardo was kind and quick to respond to emails, his place was clean and charming and located in probably the most charming area in Boston, shops were close by, and getting to different areas in Boston, whether walking or taking the train, was extremely convenient from his Beacon Hill Townhouse.", u'recipient_id': 7629859, u'can_be_edited': False, u'author_id': 1699532, u'id': 21282741}, {u'listing_id': 3377100, u'author': {u'identity_mt_verified': False, u'first_name': u'Khajag', u'identity_v2_verified': False, u'picture_large_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/18610293/profile_pic/1406003055/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_large', u'identity_verified': True, u'created_at': u'2014-07-22T04:10:43Z', u'picture_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/18610293/profile_pic/1406003055/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_x_medium', u'has_profile_pic': True, u'acceptance_rate': u'N/A', u'is_superhost': False, u'is_trip_host': False, u'thumbnail_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/18610293/profile_pic/1406003055/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_small', u'reviewee_count': 1, u'recommendation_count': 0, u'thumbnail_medium_url': u'https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/18610293/profile_pic/1406003055/original.jpg?aki_policy=profile_medium', u'response_rate': u'N/A', u'id': 18610293, u'response_time': u'N/A'}, u'created_at': u'2014-09-24T11:30:18Z', u'comments': u'Bernardo was a wonderful host: very helpful, friendly, informative, and accommodating.
